com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.contextmenu

Interface Command

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AboutCommand, AbstractLocalizedCommand, AbstractNotifingLocalizedCommand, CheckInlineCommand, CheckWithCorrectionDialogCommand, ContributeTermCommand, EditMarkingCommand, HelpCommand, IgnoreInWholeDocumentCommand, IgnoreMarkingCommand, MoreSuggestionsCommand, NextCommand, NextMainMenuCommand, NoOpCommand, NotifyingCommand, PreviousCommand, PreviousMainMenuCommand, RecheckSelectionCommand, ReplaceCommand, ReplaceInTheWholeDocumentCommand, ReplaceInTheWholeDocumentParentCommand, SeparatorCommand, SetMenuPositonCommand, ShowOptionsCommand, ShowReportCommand, SimpleNotifyingCommand, SubmitDictionaryEntryCommand, SubmitDictionaryParentEntryCommand, ToggleCommand, ToggleMarkingsCommand, ToggleStepModeCommand

    public interface Command
    The interface Command is used to provide all information for displaying a command in the GUI. It also provides a ClickHandler.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Command NULL
      The constant NULL is a null object singleton of Command doing nothing and returning empty values.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeChecked() 
      ClickHandler getClickHandler() 
      List<Command> getCommands() 
      URL getImageUrl() 
      String getText() 
      MarkingColor getTextColor() 
      String getToolTip() 
      CommandType getType() 
      boolean isBold() 
      boolean isChecked() 
      boolean isEnabled() 
      boolean isIndented() 
      boolean isShowText() 

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final Command NULL
        The constant NULL is a null object singleton of Command doing nothing and returning empty values.

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        String getText()
        Returns:
        The text of the command which should be displayed in menu.
        Note: This text could contain &-symbols for themMnemonic char and double quoted (&&) symbols if & itself should be displayed.

      • getToolTip

        String getToolTip()

      • getClickHandler

        ClickHandler getClickHandler()
        Returns:
        The ClickHandler for the command. ClickHandler.onClick() should be called if the button or menu entry for this command is clicked.

      • isBold

        boolean isBold()
        Returns:
        true, if the text of the command should be highlighted in some way. The easiest way is to display the text in bold letters.
        Note: Not all GUI-frameworks supports bold text in menus.

      • isIndented

        boolean isIndented()
        Returns:
        true, if this command should be indented in some way. The simplest way to indent the command is to add spaces before the text.

      • getImageUrl

        URL getImageUrl()
        Returns:
        The image url for this command. The image could be loaded by java resource loader. Many GUI-frameworks support methods for displaying images by url natively.

      • getTextColor

        MarkingColor getTextColor()
        Returns:
        The color in which the text should be displayed. For different Flags the associated colors will be used.

      • isShowText

        boolean isShowText()
        Returns:
        true, if the text should be shown. Otherwise only the image should be shown. If your GUI does not support images you are able to display the text anyway.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        true, if the user is allowed to execute the ClickHandler.

      • getCommands

        List<Command> getCommands()
        Returns:
        The sub commands. If you are displaying a Command you also have to display this sub-commands.

      • getType

        CommandType getType()
        Returns:
        The type of the command. This could be used to identify and filter or highlight special commands. Not every command has an own type. In this case CommandType.NULL will be used.

      • isChecked

        boolean isChecked()
        Returns:
        true, if the button should stay in pressed mode. If a GUI-component has to support this option could be queried by canBeChecked().

      • canBeChecked

        boolean canBeChecked()
        Returns:
        true, if the command could be checked. This means the button could stay pressed. In some GUI-frameworks you have to use different buttons or menu entries for this kind of button. The state, if the button is pressed or not could be queried by isChecked().
